title: Organization
body: This course guide will give you an overview of the learning goals, structure and organisation of the course and the different types of learning material and techniques you will encounter during the course.
pageBody: This course guide will give you an overview of the learning goals, structure and organisation of the course and the different types of learning material and techniques you will encounter during the course.

title: System-Context Boundaries and Types of Requirements
displayTitle: System-Context Boundaries and Types of Requirements
body: In this lecture, you will learn what differentiates systems and context, what different types of boundaries exist and why they are important for the RE process.
subtitle: Lecture L02
pageBody: In this lecture, you will learn what differentiates systems and context, what different types of boundaries exist and why they are important for the RE process.

title: Elicitation Part 1
body: Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process. Part 1 gives a general overview of the elicitation process and introduces some techniques.
subtitle: Lecture L03
pageBody: Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process. Part 1 gives a general overview of the elicitation process and introduces some techniques.

title: Introduction to Different Types of Models
displayTitle: Introduction to Different Types of Models
body: Documentation models are frameworks or structures used to systematically capture and communicate information about a system or a process. They play a crucial role in requirements and software engineering, and other fields where complex systems need to be conceptualized, analyzed, and communicated.
subtitle: Lecture L08
pageBody: The first part of this lecture will give you an introduction to documentation models in general and give you an overview over goal models, use cases, looking at the data, functional and behavioural perspective and introduce you to agent oriented modelling.

title: Requirements Traceability
body: Tracing requirements allows you to analyse and understand the relations among requirements, requirements sources and development artefacts.
subtitle: Lecture L12
pageBody: Tracing requirements allows you to analyse and understand the relations among requirements, requirements sources and development artefacts.

title: Requirements Management
body: Change management is a systematic process within project management that entails evaluating, implementing, and controlling alterations to a project's scope, requirements, or objectives.
subtitle: Lecture L11
pageBody: Change management is a systematic process within project management that entails evaluating, implementing, and controlling alterations to a project's scope, requirements, or objectives. It aims to ensure effective adaptation to evolving circumstances while maintaining project coherence and minimizing disruptions.

title: Negotiation
body: During the negotiation phase all stakeholders have to gain a common understanding of the requirements. Conflict management plays a vital part during the negotiation.
subtitle: Lecture L04
pageBody: During the negotiation phase all stakeholders have to gain a common understanding of the requirements. Conflict management plays a vital part during the negotiation.

title: Textual Requirements Specification
body: This part of the lecture on documentation covers textual requirements specification, the challenges of ambiguity, the importance of guidelines, and syntactic requirements patterns.
subtitle: Lecture L07
pageBody: This part of the lecture on documentation covers textual requirements specification, the challenges of ambiguity, the importance of guidelines, and syntactic requirements patterns.

title: Exercise 01
body: Here are the multiple-choice questions for the second lecture of the Requirements Engineering course. They cover both the introductory lecture and the second lecture.
subtitle: Multiple Choice Quiz
pageBody: Here are the multiple-choice questions for the second lecture of the Requirements Engineering course. They cover both the content of the Introductory lecture and lecture L02.

title: Introduction
body: In this lecture, you will find out why Requirements Engineering is essential for software and systems engineers, get an overview of what it is and what the different steps of the process entail.
subtitle: Lecture L01

title: Elicitation Part 2
body: In part 2 of the lecture on requirements elicitation, you will be introduced to some additional techniques to elicit information and get a summary of the whole process.
subtitle: Lecture L03

title: Colored Petri Nets
body: Documentation models are frameworks or structures that systematically capture and communicate information about a system or a process. They play a crucial role in requirements and software engineering, as well as other fields where complex systems need to be conceptualized, analyzed, and communicated.
subtitle: Lecture L08
pageBody: This lecture will provide an introduction to documentation models (Colored Petri Nets), discuss the mapping of Agent-Oriented Modelling to Colored Petri Nets, and wrap up with a summary that combines all of these ideas for a thorough grasp of modelling techniques.

title: Elicitation I
body: Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process. Part 1 gives a general overview of the elicitation process and introduces some techniques.
subtitle: Lecture L03

title: Elicitation II
body: In part 2 of the lecture on Requirements Elicitation, you will be introduced to some additional techniques to elicit information and get a summary of the whole process.
subtitle: Lecture L04
pageBody: In part 2 of the lecture on Requirements Elicitation, you will be introduced to some additional techniques to elicit information and get a summary of the whole process.

title: Negotiation
body: During the negotiation phase, all stakeholders involved must have a shared understanding of the requirements. Conflict management is essential in this procedure.
pageBody: During the negotiation phase, all stakeholders must gain a common understanding of the requirements. Conflict management plays a vital part in this process.

title: Documentation - Introduction
body: In this part of the lecture, we will focus on the foundations of documentation, including the documents' overall structure, practical templates, and well-defined requirements.
subtitle: Lecture L06
pageBody: This lecture introduces documentation fundamentals, including criteria for well-defined requirements, document structure, and document template usage.

title: Documentation - Textual Requirements Specification
body: This part of the lecture on documentation covers the intricacies of textual requirements specification. We will look at the challenges caused by ambiguity in requirements, address the vital role of established guidelines in resolving these challenges, as well as various syntactic requirements patterns that support the creation of clear and concise documentation.
pageBody: This part of the lecture on documentation covers the intricacies of textual requirements specification. We will look at the challenges caused by ambiguity in requirements, address the vital role of established guidelines in resolving these challenges, as well as various syntactic requirements patterns that support the creation of clear and concise documentation.

title: Documentation - Model-based Requirements Documentation
body: Documentation models are frameworks or structures used to systematically capture and communicate information about a system or a process.  They play a crucial role in requirements and software engineering, and other fields where complex systems need to be conceptualized, analyzed, and communicated.
subtitle: Lecture L08
pageBody: Documentation models are frameworks or structures used to systematically capture and communicate information about a system or a process. They play a crucial role in requirements and software engineering, and other fields where complex systems need to be conceptualized, analyzed, and communicated.

title: Requirements Validation
body: The validation steps of the Requirements Engineering process ensures that the implemented requirements are consistent with and meet the stakeholder's needs.
subtitle: Lecture L10
pageBody: The validation steps of the Requirements Engineering process ensures that the implemented requirements are consistent with and meet the stakeholder's needs.

title: Requirements Management
body: Change management is a systematic process within project management that entails evaluating, implementing, and controlling alterations to a project's scope, requirements, or objectives.
subtitle: Lecture L11
pageBody: Change management is a systematic process within project management that entails evaluating, implementing, and controlling alterations to a project's scope, requirements, or objectives.

title: Requirements Traceability
body: Tracing requirements allows you to analyse and understand the relations among requirements, requirements sources and development artefacts.
pageBody: Tracing requirements allows you to analyse and understand the relations among requirements, requirements sources and development artefacts.

title: Tool Support
body: Tool support for Requirements Engineering (RE) refers to the use of software tools designed to facilitate and enhance various aspects of the requirements management process.
subtitle: Lecture L13
pageBody: Tool support for Requirements Engineering (RE) refers to the use of software tools designed to facilitate and enhance various aspects of the requirements management process. These tools assist in capturing, analyzing, documenting, and tracking requirements throughout the project lifecycle. They often provide requirements elicitation, traceability, version control, collaboration, and visualization, contributing to increased efficiency, accuracy, and collaboration within the RE process.

title: Elicitation
body: This lecture introduces different techniques to elicit the correct information from various stakeholders and sources. Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process.
pageBody: This lecture introduces different techniques to elicit the correct information from various stakeholders and sources. Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process.
